description: A chest nodule is a small, round growth or mass in the lung or chest wall.  They can be benign (non-cancerous) or malignant (cancerous). Size is generally less than 3cm.
most_likely_causes: Infection (e.g., granulomas from tuberculosis, fungal infections)
Exposure to environmental factors (e.g., asbestos, silica)
precautions: Regular check-ups with your doctor, especially if you have a history of smoking or exposure to environmental hazards.
Prompt medical attention for any new or worsening symptoms.
Avoid smoking and exposure to harmful substances.
diet: A balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains is recommended to support overall health.
Limit processed foods, sugary drinks, and red meat.
Consult a doctor or registered dietitian for personalized dietary advice.
effects_of_disease: Depending on the cause and size, a chest nodule can be harmless or cause serious complications, including: respiratory distress, lung damage, or even death (in the case of cancer).
